name: Cerebral Melioidosis Encephalitis
chief_complaint: I've had a high fever for days, my head hurts terribly, and I can't think straight

lab_results.CSF analysis: elevated WBCs (800/mm3, 80% neutrophils), protein 120 mg/dL, glucose 40 mg/dL
lab_results.MRI brain: multiple small ring-enhancing lesions with surrounding edema

prognosis: Guarded - mortality ~40% even with treatment. Survivors often have residual neurological deficits
description: A rare but severe CNS manifestation of melioidosis caused by B. pseudomallei, typically occurring in immunocompromised hosts or those with chronic conditions. Presents as a subacute meningoencephalitis with characteristic abscess formation. Endemic in Southeast Asia and Northern Australia.
risk_factors: exposure to contaminated soil/water in endemic areas
